text: Octamer transcription factors and the cell type - specificity of immunoglobulin gene expression .
Antibodies are produced exclusively in B lymphocytes .
The expression of the antibody-encoding genes , the immunoglobulin ( Ig ) genes , is also restricted to B cells .
The octamer sequence ATGCAAAT is present in the promoter and the enhancer of Ig genes , and plays an important role in its tissue - specific expression .
This sequence motif is a binding site for nuclear proteins , the so-called octamer transcription factors ( Oct or OTF factors ) .

The <extra_id_0> Oct-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein is present in all cell types analyzed so far , whereas <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Oct-2B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are found mainly in B lymphocytes .

text: All three proteins show the same sequence specificity and binding affinity .

It appears that the B cell - specific expression of Ig genes is mediated at least in part by cell type - specific Oct factors , and that there are both quantitative and qualitative differences between <extra_id_0> Oct-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> factors .
Recently , a number of other octamer factor variants were identified .
Many of these may be created by alternative splicing of a primary transcript of one Oct factor gene and may serve a specific function in the fine tuning of gene expression .
